alert.note: Alert for Van Horn and Highway 54 Corridor (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 3:09PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Culberson County through 400 PM CDT... At 309 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Van Horn, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Van Horn and Culberson County Airport. This includes Interstate 10 between mile markers 136 and 151. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
